author: sky.cactus
content: If it were me, I would name the testnet after the git commit hash of the spec it follows.  That makes it very easy to correlate the network and the version of the EIP that network is targeting.

author: sky.cactus
content: As far as next step, if we are ready for vNext, then I propose everyone check out my latest PR which applies all of the changes we have been discussing and if no one disagrees we merge it and target it.  The currently merged EIP I think represents what is currently on the Besu/Geth testnet (cc <@376568077950910466> to verify).

author: matkt0
content:
> I wonder with the recent outstanding spec changes if that is still possible or not?
<@!301186049323958275> I tried with the last version of geth(https://github.com/vulcanize/go-ethereum/tree/1559_test) and besu (https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/pull/1312) and it's still possible to have a baseFee==0 at the 162 nd block without transaction (http://eip1559-testnet.ops.pegasys.tech:3000/block/162)
